[SYNTAX]: Occasionally overly complex sentence structures may slightly impede smooth reading flow.
Garbled sentence structure ("Consumer gospel...") with unclear phrasing and potential missing/misplaced words.
[LEXICON]: Overly complex vocabulary and sentence length may hinder readability for non-specialized audiences.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from critique of materialism to discussion of global integration without clear connective tissue.
[CLARITY]: Unexplained Bahá'í references (e.g., "the Physician") may confuse unfamiliar readers.

[SYNTAX]: Jumbled sentence structure (e.g., "Down experience music...") with missing articles and incorrect word order.
[GRAMMAR]: Repetitive prepositions ("for to of") and fragmented phrases (e.g., "aspect the and society").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift after "The problem is, of course, twofold" without clear connection.
[CLARITY]: Logical gaps (e.g., sudden rhetorical question without setup).
[STRUCTURE]: Minor disjointedness in paragraph flow (e.g., "What has not changed...").

[SYNTAX]: Severely garbled sentence structure (e.g., "This the of find...")
[GRAMMAR]: Misplaced or missing articles/prepositions in complex phrases
[LEXICON]: Overly dense, archaic vocabulary (e.g., "unfailing guidance essential to its spiritual and moral development")

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between critiques of religious conceptions and introduction of Bahá'í teachings
[STRUCTURE]: Ideas (e.g., God’s nature, prophetic roles, societal impact) loosely connected without clear thematic bridges

[GRAMMAR]: Errors in sentence structure (e.g., "the ongoing fact the revelation...")
[LEXICON]: Overly complex vocabulary in some segments (e.g., "metamorphoses underwent") - [SPELLING/TYPO] Apparent errors (e.g., "men man")

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between ideas (e.g., jump from customs to scriptural quotes)
[STRUCTURE]: Overly dense paragraphs lacking clear topic sentences
[CLARITY]: Concepts occasionally obscured by overly abstract language

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift in topic in final paragraph.
[CLARITY]: Incomprehensible sentence at end disrupting flow.

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex, lengthy sentence structures may impede immediate clarity.

[TRANSITION]: Minor abruptness in introducing Bahá'u'lláh’s quote without explicit prior contextualization within the segment.

[SYNTAX]: Severely disjointed sentence structure in one paragraph.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition to Bahá'í community example;

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally lengthy sentences may impede immediate clarity.
Overly complex, convoluted sentence structures (e.g., "The declared purpose of history's series...").
[LEXICON]: Archaic or overly formal vocabulary (e.g., "eschatological Event", "stupendous enterprise"). - [SPELLING/Grammar] Corrupted text fragment ("Bahá'u'lláh common enter healing...") disrupting flow.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition between historical consciousness and 20th-century moral vacuum.
[LOGIC]: Repetitive thematic assertions (e.g., Kingdom of God) without clear paragraph-level connections.
[CLARITY]: Obscure metaphors ("genetic code of the rational soul") lacking contextual clarity.
